span.a: CLICK HERE FOR STUDENT INTERNET ACCESS SURVEY

span.span: District Learning Plan Information for PK-12th grade

We appreciate your patience and support as we are navigating through uncharted territory as a public school. The school buildings will be closed for the remainder of the school year but your child’s education will continue. HPS Distance Learning Plan was approved by the Oklahoma State Department of Education and we will put this plan into action April 6th-May 8th, 2020. Each grade level across the district may look a little different but overall ALL students will have options to continue learning. We encourage all families to take advantage of the online options that will be available. Core classes will be our focus. Families that do not have adequate access to the internet will be given the option of utilizing an instructional packet. The packets can be picked up for Pre-K through 12th grade on Monday, April 6th from 10:00-1:00. All sites will be distributing the packets from the car rider line at each building.

All high school students have a Chromebook to utilize for online core classes via Odysseyware. However, some students left their Chromebook in their locker and will need to come pick them up Monday, April 6th from 10:00-1:00. The Odysseyware classes are set up and ready for student access. If you need help with your login or password please contact Kathy Snyder at ksnyder@henryetta.k12.ok.us. ACT test prep will be added to Odysseyware as an enrichment. Financial Literacy still needs to be completed and will be assigned through Odysseyware or packet form. Khan Academy is a great resource to enhance student learning. Khan Academy has a library of standards-aligned lessons covering kindergarten through early college math, grammar, science, history, AP courses and more. Students can practice skills with exercises, quizzes and mastery challenges and get immediate feedback and support. They are even sharing suggested daily schedules with links to curriculum sorted by grade-level bands.

For Middle School students that have internet, Wi-Fi, or hotspot we have provided enrichment through USA Testprep which the students are already familiar with. This material will be able to be monitored by our teachers during this time. Information on how to log in will be provided on our school website beginning Monday, April 6 if not before.

Our elementary teachers have been trying to make contact with all parents to guide parents through the distance learning plan. Parents can access the Distance Learning online links from our school website under the grade level tabs. If you have not heard from your child’s teacher, we are lacking valid contact information. Please make an effort to contact the teacher. Any parents that need to update contact information, please call 918-652-6587 ext. 2250 April 3rd-10th between 12:00-1:00.
Watch our school Facebook page and school website (www.henryetta.k12.ok.us) for details and updates.
Roger Williams, HES Assistant Principal rwilliams@henryetta.k12.ok.us

p.span: At this time, as long as CDC guidelines have been lifted, Henryetta Public Schools has set a traditional graduation date on Sat., July 11 @ 8:00 p.m. at Cameron Field, and prom on Fri., July 10 from 7:00 pm. - 11:00 pm. at the High School Cafeteria. An alternate plan for graduation in case the guidelines haven't been lifted would be a virtual graduation on Fri., July 24 at 4:00 p.m. at Henryetta High School.

div.p: As long as CDC guidelines have been lifted, HPSs has set a traditional graduation date on Sat., July 11 @ 8:00 p.m. at Cameron Field, and prom on Fri., July 10 from 7:00 pm. - 11:00 pm. at the HS Cafeteria. An alternate plan for graduation in case the guidelines haven't been lifted would be a virtual graduation on Fri., July 24 at 4:00 p.m. at Henryetta High School.
Click the Elementary tab and your grade level for more information or click here.
Questions regarding JOM — Call Bryan Leader at HHS — 918-652-6571, ext. 7702

The Henryetta School System does not discriminate on the basis of

p.strong: Contact Info for Title IX, Section 504 or Title II, ADA

hr.p: With changing times in education, the Oklahoma State department of Education would like to inform parents about child find opportunities. "All children with disabilities, residing in the State, whether attending public or private schools, should be identified, located, and evaluated.” In Oklahoma we require that child find apply to all children who are suspected of having a disability and in need of special education.and related services. We want to make everyone aware of this service that is provided to children with disabilities free of charge throughout the State of Oklahoma. If you would like more information on child find, contact:

p.strong:
Sally Moore
Henryetta Public Schools
(918) 652-6587 ext. 2201

Oklahoma State Department of Education
Special Education Services
(405) 522-3248

hr.p: Help to find our children the education they deserve.
